definition: guests feel at home (in a hotel, guest house etc)/a home away from home

to return/to go back to/to give back to/(of a responsibility) to be taken care of by/to belong to/to gather together/(used between two identical verbs) despite/to marry (of a woman) (old)/division on the abacus with a one-digit divisor

sentences.english: The room had a cozy, homelike atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 這房間有一種賓至如歸的舒適氛圍。

sentences.english: All travellers find this hotel a home from home.
sentences.chinese: 在這家飯店住宿的旅客都有賓至如歸的感覺。

sentences.english: I did not feel welcome outside the door.
sentences.chinese: 我在這扇門之外並沒有賓至如歸的感覺。

sentences.english: Ruben, the host, made all the arrangements and requested his wife to prepare dinner and make Bernard feel at home.
sentences.chinese: 並要太太準備豐富的餐點，讓伯納感到賓至如歸。

sentences.english: And, indeed, Zi Fi is a restaurant designed to make the successful businessman feel at home.
sentences.chinese: 子非會館確實是一個能夠讓成功商人賓至如歸的地方。

sentences.english: "I feel at home when I am in Egypt, " said Wen.
sentences.chinese: 我來到埃及大有賓至如歸的感覺。

sentences.english: We wish you can talk heart-to-heart, and receive home feeling.
sentences.chinese: 我們希望你能心連心地交流，賓至如歸。

definition: both the guests and the hosts thoroughly enjoy themselves (idiom)
to eat one's fill/to have a good meal
brimming with enthusiasm (idiom); full of warmth
lit. clear window and clean table (idiom)/fig. bright and clean
to get rid of the old to bring in the new (idiom); to innovate
surrounded by distinguished friends (idiom); in company
elated/light and airy feeling (after a few drinks)/smug and conceited/complacent
